summary: 17 CFR § 230.251 outlines exemptions for public offerings and sales of eligible securities under Regulation A of the Securities Act of 1933, distinguishing between Tier 1 (up to $20 million) and Tier 2 (up to $75 million) offerings, with specific limitations on secondary sales and requirements for issuers. The regulation also details offering conditions, including the necessity of filing an offering statement with the SEC and restrictions on sales until qualification.
